title: 109_hr3301
content: Investment credit for trucks with new diesel technology is allowed under section 48A of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986. The new diesel technology credit allows for a 5 percent credit on the cost of qualified trucks placed in service between January 1, 2007, and January 1, 2008. Qualified trucks must be propelled by diesel fuel, have a gross vehicle weight rating over 26,000 pounds, and comply with EPA regulations for diesel emissions. The Internal Revenue Code of 1986 is amended to include the new diesel technology credit, providing a 5 percent credit on qualified trucks placed in service between January 1, 2007, and January 1, 2008. Qualified trucks must be diesel-fueled, weigh over 26,000 pounds, and meet EPA diesel emissions regulations. Amendments include changes to Section 49(a)(1)(C) and the table of sections for subpart E of part IV of subchapter A of chapter 1. The Internal Revenue Code of 1986 includes a new diesel technology credit for qualified trucks placed in service between January 1, 2007, and January 1, 2008. The credit allows for a 5 percent credit on diesel-fueled trucks weighing over 26,000 pounds that meet EPA emissions regulations. Amendments have been made to Section 49(a)(1)(C) and the table of sections for subpart E of part IV of subchapter A of chapter 1. The new diesel technology credit allows for a 5 percent credit on qualified trucks placed in service between January 1, 2007, and January 1, 2008, that meet EPA emissions regulations. Amendments have been made to Section 49(a)(1)(C) and the table of sections for subpart E of part IV of subchapter A of chapter 1 to include the new diesel technology credit. The new diesel technology credit, effective from January 1, 2007, applies to property placed in service after that date. SEC. 179C allows for the election to expense new diesel technology trucks. Taxpayers can elect to treat the cost of qualified trucks as expenses, deductible in the year the truck is placed in service. The election must be made on the tax return and is irrevocable without the Secretary's consent. This provision does not apply to trucks placed in service after December 31, 2007. The Internal Revenue Code is amended to allow taxpayers to deduct the cost of qualified trucks as expenses in the year they are placed in service. Taxpayers can elect to expense new diesel technology trucks placed in service on or after January 1, 2007.
